Sir Edward Carson,K.0.,M.P.I The following were also presentThe Right Hon.A.J.Balfour,0.M.,M.P.,Secretary of State for ForeignAffairs.The Right Hon. the Earl of Derbyj E.G.,G.C.V.0.,0.B., Secretary of Statefor War.General Sir'W. R. Robert son, G.C.B.,K.C.V.O., D.S.O.Lieutenant-Colonel Sir M.P.A.Hankey, K.C.B.,Secretary.Fleet Paymaster P.H.Row, R.N., Assistant Secretary.Captain Clement Jones, Assistant Secretary.The War Cabinet had a short preliminary discussion as tothe possibility of exploiting General Allenby's victoriesin a diplomatic direction. The further consideration of thequestion was adjourned until certain Memoranda, one of whichwas to be provided by the Chief of the Imperial General Staff,were available.z* Whitehall Gardens, S.W.,November 14, 1917.
